item.title: Reddit's blackout protest is set to continue indefinitely
item.description: - Reddit's blackout protest is continuing indefinitely, with many popular subreddits still inaccessible.

item.title: Reddit Threatens to Remove Moderators from Subreddits Continuing Blackouts
item.description: - Reddit threatens to remove moderators from subreddits that continue blackouts protesting the company's plans to charge high prices for its API.

item.title: My 24 year old HP Jornada can do things an iPhone still can't do
item.description: - The author discusses their favorite retro device, the HP Jornada 720, which is a small handheld PC released in 1999 and runs Windows CE or Linux.

item.title: Sequence diagrams, the only good thing UML brought to software development
item.description: - Sequence diagrams are a useful way to document how different parts of a system interact with each other.

item.title: Our Plan for Python 3.13
item.description: - The plan for Python 3.13 is similar to the previous plan for 3.12, but with some important differences.

item.title: Effective Rust (2021)
item.description: - This post is about improving your Rust code and using best practices.

item.title: Unihiker, an $80 single-board PC with 2.8" touchscreen, quad-core ARM Cortex-A35
item.description: - Unihiker is a single-board computer (SBC) with a 2.8-inch touchscreen, Wi-Fi, and Bluetooth.

item.title: Archaeologists find 3000-year-old sword, exceptionally well preserved
On the slow productivity of John Wick
item.description: - The success of the movie John Wick is attributed to its visually-arresting action sequences.

item.title: 11 years of hosting a SaaS
item.description: - The author reflects on their experiences hosting a SaaS app for 11 years and shares the lessons they've learned.
